title: button
description: A versatile button component that can be used in different styles and sizes.

import.description: This code shows how to import the Button component from the library.

examples.title: Default
Sizes
Radius
Colors
Borders

propsTable.title: Button Props
propsTable.description: List of all props supported by the Button component.

rows.description: Content to be displayed inside the button.
Aria label for accessibility. Provides additional context for screen readers.
Defines the color of the button. Options are: 'primary', 'secondary', 'success', 'warning', 'danger'.
Callback function triggered when the button is clicked.
Inline styles to be applied to the button.
Defines the size of the button. Options are: 'sm', 'md', 'lg'.
Defines the border-radius of the button. Options are: 'none', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'full'.
Defines the border width of the button. Options are: 'none', 'xs', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl'.
Additional CSS class names to apply to the button.

eventsTable.title: Events
eventsTable.description: List of all events emitted by the Button component.

rows.type: Triggered when the button is clicked.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Accessibility considerations for the Button component.

ariaRoles.description: The Button component is rendered with the button role by default.
If the button has only an icon and no text, you should add an aria-label for screen readers.

title: modal
description: A modal component that can be customized with various sizes, placements, scroll options, and backdrop styles.

import.description: This code shows how to import the Modal component from the library.

propsTable.title: Modal Props
propsTable.description: List of all props supported by the Modal component.

rows.description: Content to be displayed inside the modal body.
Content to be displayed in the modal header section.
Content to be displayed in the modal body, as an alternative to 'children'.
Defines the size of the modal. Options are: 'sm', 'md', 'lg'.
Defines the border-radius of the modal. Options are: 'none', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'full'.
Defines the placement of the modal on the screen. Options are: 'center', 'top', 'bottom'.
Defines the backdrop style of the modal. Options are: 'transparent', 'dark'.
Defines the color theme of the modal. Options are: 'primary', 'secondary', 'success', 'warning', 'danger'.
Additional CSS class names to apply to the modal.

eventsTable.title: Events
eventsTable.description: List of all events emitted by the Modal component.

rows.description: Triggered when the modal is opened.
Triggered when the modal is closed.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Accessibility considerations for the Modal component.

ariaRoles.description: The Modal component is rendered with the 'dialog' role to provide a container for the modal content.
The modal has an 'aria-modal' attribute set to 'true' to indicate it's a modal dialog.
The modal can be closed by clicking the backdrop, which should be announced to users if they need alternative options for closing.
Ensures keyboard focus is retained within the modal when open, and provides a close button accessible via keyboard navigation.
